meanings.definition: Prevent or obstruct (an anticipated event or action) by taking action ahead of time.
meanings.sent1: She forestalled the argument by offering a compromise.
meanings.sent2: The security measures forestalled any potential threats.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox forestalled the hunter by taking a different path.
meanings.sent4: Her quick thinking forestalled disaster from striking.
meanings.sent5: The early arrival of the firefighters forestalled the spread of the fire.

meanings.definition: Anticipate and deal with (a problem or difficulty) before it occurs.
meanings.sent1: He forestalled the technical issue by updating the software.
meanings.sent2: The team forestalled any delays by preparing in advance.
meanings.sent3: The student forestalled failing the test by studying diligently.
meanings.sent4: The doctor's advice forestalled any health complications.
meanings.sent5: The timely repair forestalled a major breakdown of the machinery.
